question: What position does Antoni Xuclà Bas hold?

content.source_1:
Title: The Unwavering Voice of Democracy: Antoni Xuclà Bas, a Pillar of the Cortes Españolas

In the tumultuous landscape of post-Civil War Spain, a beacon of hope emerged in the form of Antoni Xuclà Bas, a stalwart politician who dedicated his life to upholding the principles of democracy. As a procurador en Cortes, Xuclà Bas played a pivotal role in shaping the country's legislative landscape, leaving an indelible mark on the Cortes Españolas, the Spanish parliament, from 1943 to 1977. Born in 1913, Xuclà Bas grew up in a Spain torn apart by political and social unrest. The devastating consequences of the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939) had left the country reeling, and the subsequent dictatorship of General Francisco Franco had stifled democratic voices. Yet, Xuclà Bas remained resolute in his commitment to democratic ideals, undeterred by the oppressive regime. In 1943, Xuclà Bas took his first step into the political arena, becoming a procurador en Cortes, a member of the Cortes Españolas. This esteemed position granted him a platform to advocate for the rights of the Spanish people, and he seized it with unwavering determination. As a procurador, Xuclà Bas was tasked with representing the interests of his constituents, working tirelessly to promote social justice, economic development, and political reform. One of Xuclà Bas's most significant contributions during this period was his unwavering support for the Spanish economy. As the country struggled to rebuild in the aftermath of the Civil War, Xuclà Bas championed policies aimed at stimulating growth, creating jobs, and improving living standards. His efforts were instrumental in shaping the country's economic landscape, paving the way for Spain's eventual transition to a modern, industrialized nation. Xuclà Bas's commitment to democracy was further demonstrated through his vocal opposition to Franco's authoritarian regime. Despite the risks, he consistently spoke out against human rights abuses, advocating for greater freedoms and protections for the Spanish people. His courageous stance earned him the respect and admiration of his peers, as well as the ire of the Franco regime. Throughout his tenure as a procurador en Cortes, Xuclà Bas worked closely with other like-minded politicians, forming alliances and coalitions to push for democratic reforms.
content.source_2:
**Breaking News**

In a surprise move, renowned Spanish politician Antoni Xuclà Bas has been appointed as the new Head of ETH Zürich, one of the world's top-ranked science and technology universities. Bas, a seasoned politician with a strong background in education and innovation, will take the reins of the esteemed institution, effective immediately. The announcement was made earlier today at a press conference in Zurich, Switzerland, where Bas addressed the media and outlined his vision for the university's future. "I am honored to take on this new challenge and lead ETH Zürich into a new era of excellence," Bas said. "As a politician, I have always been committed to fostering innovation and driving progress. I believe that ETH Zürich, with its rich history and exceptional talent, is the perfect platform to make a meaningful impact." Bas's appointment comes as a surprise to many, given his lack of direct experience in academia. However, his supporters argue that his unique blend of political acumen and passion for education makes him an ideal candidate for the role. "Antoni has a proven track record of bringing people together and driving change," said Dr. Maria Rodriguez, a professor of engineering at ETH Zürich. "We are excited to have him on board and look forward to working with him to take our university to new heights." According to sources close to the university, Bas's appointment was the result of a rigorous selection process, which saw him emerge as the top candidate from a pool of over 20 applicants. "Antoni's vision for the university, combined with his exceptional leadership skills, made him the standout candidate," said Dr. Ursula Keller, Chair of the ETH Zürich Board of Directors. "We are confident that he will be an excellent Head of ETH Zürich and take our institution to even greater heights." Bas's first priority will be to meet with faculty members and students to discuss his vision for the university and listen to their concerns. He has also pledged to increase funding for research initiatives and strengthen ties with industry partners. "I want to make sure that ETH Zürich remains at the forefront of innovation and continues to produce talented graduates who can make a real difference in the world," Bas said. Data released by the university shows that ETH Zürich has seen a significant increase in applications over the past year, with a 25% rise in international students. Bas's appointment is expected to further boost the university's reputation and attract top talent from around the world.

answer: Procurador en Cortes (member of the Cortes Españolas).
